ygData.subject: Re: Fear and level 16 spell questions
ygData.msgSnippet: I live (and die) by mesmerize, so I have a pretty expansive knowledge base on it. Given that though, I can t determine any hard, fast rules for it. My latest
ygData.messageBody:
I live (and die) by mesmerize, so I have a pretty expansive knowledge base
on it. Given that though, I can't determine any hard, fast rules for it. My
latest use for it has been in East Karana against gorge hounds. Sometimes
the battle just doesn't go right, and it's time to quit it. About half the
time on gorge hounds, after a mesmerize, the hound will come after me again.
In those cases, mesmerize is just a 10 second head start. However, I have
NEVER had a critter that I have not damaged yet come for me after being
mesmerized.

I will always try to use mesmerize instead of memory blur because of its
fast cast time and low mana use. If the critter still seems to want a piece
of me afterwards I mesmerize it again and reevaluate the situation.

Just my experience...

> -----Original Message-----
> From: HiFi Review [SMTP:hifireview@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, June 29, 1999 1:16 PM
> To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Fear and level 16 spell questions
>
> From: HiFi Review <hifireview@...>
>
> Try it and see. You have to use a monster of aproximately your level
> because lower level ones will remove you from their hate list just
> because of the level difference (See Brad McQuaid's response to
> concerns about trains).
>
> Hit the monster, then mesmerize it. Get out of frenzy range and wait
> to see if it comes after you after it wears off. Then you'll know your
> answer. I have gotten pounded by a few after mes wears off, so I don't
> think it does wipe the list. Please post the result of your
> experiment.
>
> --- Scott Murawski <scott@...> wrote:
> > From: Scott Murawski <scott@...>
> >
> > >If you haven't damaged the beastie yet, mesmerize
> > will suffice to keep it
> > >off of you since it hasn't built up a 'hate list'
> > yet. I used it just last
> >
> > I thought mesmerize wiped the hate list, so even if
> > you did damage it, the
> > mob still just
> > walks off.
> >
> > >night in East Karana when the person luring for our
> > party brought in a crag
> > >spider and a carrion spider. I just mezzed the
> > carrion spider, and while we
> > >were fighting the crag spider, the carrion spider
> > just wandered off, no mem
> > >blur needed...
> >
> > I thought mesmerize was a better version of mem
> > blur, except you cant use
> > it on higher level mobs.
> >
> > Azboklin
> >
> >
